column4: yup... move to India if you want to be a programmer and get ready to be paid $2/hr.
if you want a career guaranteed to pay good money learn mainframes.  :)

you know, that attitude is what made me not want to do CS when i was in high school. hard to keep me away from it though, so i'm back to it. turns out being able to program and knowing linux pretty well means you're not really subject to outsourcing
- Linux administration, yes.  Programming anything... way cheaper to offshore.
nah. plenty of development happens in first world countries
its the tech support that's outsourced most
